thread.title: Thousands of North Easterners demand the immediate triggering of Article 50
thread.title_full: Thousands of North Easterners demand the immediate triggering of Article 50

author: nechronicle
title: Thousands of North Easterners demand the immediate triggering of Article 50
text:
Thousands of North Easterners demand the immediate triggering of Article 50 18:30, 16 Jul 2016 By Scott Trotter Petition for Britain to exit the European Union as soon as possible welcomed by thousands in region Shares Get daily news by email British Prime Minister Theresa May speaks outside 10 Downing Street on July 13, 2016 in London, England 
Almost 4,500 people from the North East have given their signature hoping to trigger Article 50 immediately. 
Residents in Blyth Valley and South Shields have been particularly prominent with one in every 400 people giving their signatures in the hope of exiting the European Union (EU) as soon as possible. 
There were 203 people from Blyth Valley, alongside 201 from South Shields who put their name to the petition. 
Newcastle­ North and Sunderland Central constituencies had around 200 signatures, with North Tyneside already at 207. 
Durham City and Newcastle­ Central buck the trend with one in 714 and one in 909 people signing the petition respectively. 
Blyth Valley MP Ronnie Campbell said: “I think by the end of this month we should get on with it.” Blyth Valley MP Ronnie Campbell 
Mr Campbell admitted that there was an argument for “pre­talks” but he believes the European consensus is against them. 
European leaders including François Hollande and Angela Merkel agreed following the referendum result that “there will be no formal or informal talks about Britain’s exit” until Article 50 is triggered. 
“If that’s the way they’re thinking, lets get on with it,” said the Blyth Valley MP. 
One hundred thousand signatories are required for the motion to be considered for debate in Parliament. It currently lies over 98,000. 
Both Blyth Valley and South Shields constituencies, however, fall far below Lincolnshire’s Louth and Horncastle which has provided more than 300 signatures, equal to around one in every 312 people. Read More EU Referendum: What is Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty and what does it mean? 
The petition has been open online since June 30 
David Davis, the newly appointed Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union has said in the past that Article 50 would be “triggered before or by the beginning of next year”. 
Just days into the job, new Prime Minister Theresa May is being put under pressure to go against her earlier comments that the Brexit process would not begin until after the end of 2016. 
She said: “What is important is that we do this in the right time­scale and we do it to get the right deal for the UK.” 
Article 50 is the part of the Lisbon treaty which begins the process of the UK’s withdrawal from the European Union. Once initiated there is a period of two years to negotiate the exit, unless the European Council wishes to extend it.
